title: Publish readiness: unblock frontend build and add readiness + publishing guidance UI

requirements.summary: Eliminate frontend build/type/lint blockers so the production build completes successfully (including unused imports).
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend` production build completes successfully with no TypeScript errors.
No ESLint/TS unused import issues remain in committed code (e.g., remove unused `useEffect` import in `frontend/src/App.tsx`).

file_operations.description: Remove the unused React `useEffect` import (and any other unused symbols discovered while addressing build/lint/type errors) to ensure a clean production build.

As new UI sections are added (publish readiness + how-to), ensure imports remain minimal and free of unused symbols to avoid lint/type build blockers. Use existing shadcn/ui primitives already present in the codebase; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a small frontend diagnostics UI that runs a publish readiness check against the canister and displays results in English (success/failure and caller principal text).
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes at least one query method that returns the caller Principal (or its text form) and a static status/version string.
Frontend provides a visible UI element (e.g., on the landing page or a small diagnostics panel) that triggers the call and renders success/failure states in English.
When run anonymously, the readiness check still returns a valid response (showing the anonymous principal) without crashing.

file_operations.description: Implement a minimal React Query hook (e.g., `usePublishReadinessCheck`) that uses `useActor()` to call the backend readiness function (`checkCanisterStatus`) and returns normalized UI-ready states (idle/loading/success/error) with the caller principal rendered as text.

Add a visible 'Publish readiness check' section to the landing page with a button to trigger/refetch the check and English success/failure rendering (including the returned principal text). Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card/Button) for consistent UI; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a concise 'How to publish' help section in the frontend UI with clear English steps and a short troubleshooting checklist.
acceptanceCriteria: The app includes a clearly labeled section such as “How to publish” with step-by-step guidance in English.
The help text includes a brief troubleshooting checklist focused on common causes like build failures and missing assets, without referencing unsupported third-party platforms.
No backend changes are required to view this help content.

file_operations.description: Add a clearly labeled 'How to publish' section with step-by-step English instructions focused on publishing after a successful build, plus a concise troubleshooting checklist (build failures, missing assets, local environment/dfx issues). Use existing shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card) to present the content; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
